tool.name: MethylIT: Build unique GRange
tool.description: from a list of GRange objects
tool.command: #import os #import re #set input_dir='input_dir' mkdir input_dir && #for $i in $input: #set file_name = $i.file_name #set identifier = re.sub('[^\s\w\-\\.]', '_', str($i.element_identifier)) ln -s '$file_name' '$input_dir/$identifier' && #end for Rscript '$__tool_directory__/methylit_unique_granges.R' --input_dir '$input_dir' --ncols $ncols #if str($specify_columns_cond.specify_columns) == "yes": --columns '$specify_columns_cond.columns' #end if #if str($specify_chromosomes_cond.specify_chromosomes) == "yes": --chromosomes '$specify_chromosomes_cond.chromosomes' #end if #if str($overlap_cond.overlap) == "yes": --maxgap $overlap_cond.maxgap --minoverlap $overlap_cond.minoverlap #end if #if str($specify_missing_cond.specify_missing) == "yes": --missing $specify_missing_cond.missing #end if --overlap_type '$overlap_type' --select '$select' --ignore_strand '$ignore_strand' --num_cores \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} --output '$output' &>process_log.txt

param.name: ncols
param.label: Number of columns to use from the metadata of each GRange
param.help: --ncols: if set to 0, all columns from each GRange will be included in the output

param.name: specify_columns
param.label: Specify columns to use from the meta-column of each GRange object?

param.name: columns
param.label: Comma-separated list of numbers of each column to use from the GRange objects

param.name: chromosomes
param.label: Comma-separated list of chromosomes to use from the GRange objects

param.name: overlap
param.label: Specify overlap interval?
param.help: Positions within this interval will be considered overlapping

param.name: maxgap
param.label: Maximum gap for finding interval overlaps between GRange objects

param.name: minoverlap
param.label: Minimum gap for finding interval overlaps between GRange objects

param.name: specify_missing
param.label: Specify value to us for GRange objects with missing values?

param.name: missing
param.label: Value to use for missing values in GRange objects

tool.help:
**What it does**
Build a unique GRange object from a list of GRange objects. The metadata of each of these GRange objects must have one or more columns to yield a unique GRange object with metadata columns from the original GRange objects. Otherwise, a unique GRange object will becreated without metadata columns. Additionally, all metadata must be the same class (i.e. numeric characters, or factor).
